data.title: GREAT SPORTS BAR AND PEOPLE WATCHING
data.text: With all the visible TV screens this is a great place for sports.  There is an interesting selection of food that is very good.  There is also a couple of outdoor patios, perfect for enjoying a great Surf City day and watching people.

data.title: GREAT ATMOSPHERE
data.text: We really enjoyed the beach front atmosphere on Main Street in Huntington Beach. Great people, great food.

data.title: 8 bucks for a beer during happy hour?!!!!!!!
data.text:
Came in tonite to have a beer before i went home. Tuesdays in downtown is beach city nights . A street fair. The eateries usually have a lot of people in them. Most places were crowed . This place was dead. The bar had one other person.
I sat and ordered a guiness.when it was served i was told it was 7 buck. That is high for a beer and high for a guiness to the point of out of line. But it was in front of me. So i paid and was given two bucks in change. ??

I asked about thi and was told the beer was 8 dollars!!!!

Okay that is stupid money. I also noted no recipt. So i am curious it the money went into the till.

The service was lousy. The place was empty. No offer of a menu , nothing. Hope the manger sees this. Lots of places for a beer on main. This is no longer one for me.

data.title: I like the look of this place
data.text: We visited on a Monday early evening which is a slow time at the HB pier area. So we were not surprised the place was empty. After reading other posts I am surprised by the comments.  We liked the look of the bar.  There are two separate bar areas. I think it would be a good place to watch sports although there was a game on that did not  interest us that evening.  The Happy Hour menu was nicely priced.  I had the chicken tacos that were quite good.  Others had the wings which  they enjoyed. We did not have a problem with the waiter who happened to be the bartender.  And I had a chat with the manager who was very friendly.  I am surprised that not many bars in downtown HB validate parking including this one.

data.title: Great Sunday Football Watching!
data.text: Beachfront 301 has two sides to it - restaurant during the day and club at night. The food is good, but it feels like a lounge more than a restaurant. It is a great place to have breakfast and watch football on Sundays.

data.title: Food is bad and so is the drinks, poor service.
data.text: There is a reason this place is so quiet, just walk by and if you see a crowd is because there is a football game on or a fight on cable.

data.title: Average sports bar
data.text: Average all around. They have a good selection of beer on tap and the food is typical sports bar fare. I had the buffalo chicken sandwich and enjoyed it enough to order again. The atmosphere is lacking, the street outside is packed and no one is inside this place which is kind of weird

data.title: ho hum food at best...  fun spot for fights pay-per-view
data.text: food and service?  yuck.. but a great spot for seeing pay per view fights!  Lots of super drunk kids here sometimes so be patient lol...

data.title: Worst service ever. So unfriendly and serve stale beer
data.text: We had the best dining experience in HB until we found this bar/restaurant.  We were at the farmers market and waiting for our daughters turn to jump at the bungee cords and my husband said lets just go in here for appetizers and a beer. The bartender was so rude my daughter and I just left and when my husband ordered his beer she tried to sell him green stale beer from st paddys day (2 weeks later) and when he said no I would like what I ordered ,she gave him attitude and wouldn't even talk to him the rest of the time. I will never go back. Customer service is everything and this place is lacking it. So I you want stale green beer and bad attitude go here

data.title: Typical bar
data.text: Located on Main St. The food was ok and priced right considering the quality of the food. The service was good. We had lunch there and the place was pretty empty on a Saturday afternoon.

data.title: The un-busy sports bar on Saturday game
data.text:
7 of us were in the area & wanted to catch some games on Saturday afternoon. We don't know HB so we stopped in here.
Happy hour specials on Saturday afternoon are a good selling point.
The place was dead, which is ok- but on a Saturday afternoon is a bit odd.
The location has seen better days as the booths are ripped throughout, bathrooms are dreadful & overall cleanliness is pretty low. 
It looks like a bar getting ready for an episode of bar rescue.
The food was ok- so that was good.
Our sever was friendly & good. As soon as he left his shift, it was like pulling teeth to get service from the new waitress.

data.title: Good location, good people watching
data.text: 301 sits on a corner of Main St in downtown Huntington Beach, and has outdoor seating so it is a prime location in the summer for getting a little sun and watching the crowds go by.  The food is middle of the road bar fare and the prices are reasonable.  Daily specials and Happy Hour have some great deals. This place caters to a younger crowd and it can get rowdy, so I would not recommend it for families with kids.  The service is slow but friendly.

data.title: NEVER EVER ANSWERS THERE PHONES!!!
data.text: This place would be okay if someone would just answer the damn phones. I've called both listed numbers for 4 days and no answer.

data.title: Nothing good to say about it
data.text: I was at the beachfront 301 and the place was pretty empty on a Sunday at dinner time. It took 10 minutes to get a menu and there wasn't anyone else in there eating so you have to question what they are doing. When I finally order I get my food and its the WRONG ITEM. The waitress didn't come back over for another 10 minutes so by that time I started eating it. When she finally did I mentioned that his was not what I ordered and she said then that she typed it in wrong. I assumed that she was going to take it off the bill since its not what I wanted, NOPE when the bill came she actually had  it on there. SHE ACTUALLY GAVE ME A BILL FOR THE WRONG ITEM. This place has the nerve to give me the wrong food and still expect me to pay for it. I expected to get what they game me for free but was insulted by this action.

data.title: Yes it Seems Empty, but the food was
data.text: I was downtown taking care of some charity business and stopped in here.  I sat at the bar and had a soda and a chicken wrap; there were three choices for flavor, like BBQ, Caesar and ranch.   They have these amazing specials every day.  I was shocked at the portion and the flavor.  It was really, really good.  I have read reviews of the atmosphere and service standards but I did not witness that since it was fairly empty and I was at the bar.  The two servers were friendly and attentive.   They asked me at least twice if everything was good. The bill was around $5.00 and I could have added fries for $1.  I am going to try it again. I heat it is popular for lots of beer.

data.title: Fun place to watch a game
data.text: Went there on vacation to watch the nfl games. It's a 49er bar to be sure, the atmosphere and food were great.  Overall, a fun experience.

data.title: Stay Away
data.text: Our first clue that this was not the place to go was that it was practically empty on a friday night. Plus service was horrible, but I think that may have been because there was only one waitress on for maybe 5 tables that were spread out thru out the large restaurant.The bar food,which would seem to be a no brainer.... was terrible.... I had a spinach salad with grilled chicken that seemed to be rolled in seasoning salt,and my husband had a very well done(was never asked how he wanted it prepared)burger that looked like it had seen better days.... Such an awesome location, too bad the owners are dropping the ball on the atmosphere and food...

data.title: Great bar
data.text: Bar scene is good and great location. The food was just plane old bar food. Not a super choice for a great meal. And you have to fight off the drunk crowd.

data.title: Great Happy Hour
data.text:
Every day of the week there is a different happy hour special, from sliders to buffalo wings to a taco bar.  Many tv's inside with sports being the prime venue, and two outside areas for people watching and smoking.  Its a great place right on the main street of HB.
Service is a little slow if you sit outside, I usually need to go to the waitress/bar station and notify them that we are outside

data.title: No service at all - worst I've ever been treated
data.text:
I travel extensively around the world and have never been treated so poorly at a restaurant. I was on a family vacation in California and decided to stop here as it was on Main Street in Huntington Beach (a small beach town that we love). After waiting 10 minutes to even be greeted, we asked for a table of 5.  They were very busy as there were 2 games on that night (NHL Stanley Cup Finals and also the NBA Eastern Conf Finals).  After another 10 minutes, was told that it was 21 and over only and that me and my family had to leave.  I asked why and pointed out that they were a restaurant and it was only 6pm. We were given an excuse that the games were on and then later they were showing a boxing match. Again, I explained that it was only 6pm, but was completely ignored and just told that I had to leave b/c my kids were under 21. 

Do not ever visit this restaurant!!!
